data.description: Commands or dictionaries defining the test data in this test group

include.title: Inclusion
include.description: Test cases and test groups to be included in this test group from elsewhere.

testdata_settings.title: Test data settings
testdata_settings.description: The settings that apply to the test data for this test group. Will be copied to this test group's `testdata.yaml`.

input_validator_args.description: Defines arguments passed to each input validator for the test case/group. If a sequence of strings, then those are the arguments that will be passed to each input validator for this the case/group. If a map, then each key is the name of the input validator and the value is the arguments to pass to that input validator for the test case/group. Validators not present in the map are run without any arguments.

output_validator_args.description: Defines arguments passed to the output validator for the test case/group.

input_validator_flags.description: With 'problem_format_version: 2023-07-draft' in problem.yaml, use input_validator_args instead.

output_validator_flags.description: With 'problem_format_version: 2023-07-draft' in problem.yaml, use input_validator_args instead.

data_dict.title: Data Dictionary
data_dict.description: Defines the contents of a test group

testcase.title: Test Case
testcase.description: A test case, i.e., a single instance to the problem.

copy.title: Copy
copy.description: Copy this test case from the given path relative to `/generators/`.

count.title: Count
count.description: Generate this number of test cases, substituting `{count}` in the `generate:` command with values between 1 and `count`, inclusive.

in.title: Input
in.description: Explicit input given as a string

in.statement.title: Input (statement)
in.statement.description: Explicit input given as a string, only shown in problem statement (defaults to 'in')

in.download.title: Input (download)
in.download.description: Explicit input given as a string, only shown as sample download in the contest system (defaults to 'in.statement' or 'in')

ans.title: Default Answer
ans.description: Explicit default answer given as a string

ans.statement.title: Default Answer (statement)
ans.statement.description: Explicit default answer given as a strans, only shown in problem statement (defaults to 'in')

ans.download.title: Default Answer (download)
ans.download.description: Explicit default answer given as a string, only shown as sample download in the contest system (defaults to 'ans.statement' or 'ans')

out.title: Output
out.description: Explicit (in)valid output given as a string; can only be given in sample or (in)valid_output

interaction.title: Sample interaction
interaction.description: Input is prefixed with `<`, output is prefixed with `>`.

desc.title: Description
desc.description: Privileged information explaining the purpose of this test case given as a string

hint.title: Hint
hint.description: Feedback shown to the solver about this test case given as a string

solution.title: Default Solution
solution.description: Absolute path to a solution for this problem or test case.

command.title: Generator Invocation
command.description: Invocation of a generator to create this test case

description: Generate test data for this problem. Version 2025-04.

generators.title: Generators
generators.description: List of generators for this problem.

data.title: Test data root
data.description: The root test group. Must contain the test groups 'sample' and 'secret'.

sample.title: Sample inputs
sample.description: Test cases shown to the solver in the problem statement

secret.title: Secret inputs
secret.description: The test cases against which submissions are validated

invalid_input.title: Invalid inputs
invalid_input.description: Test cases whose input files are invalid

invalid_answer.title: Invalid answers
invalid_answer.description: Test cases whose answer files are invalid. Inputs must be valid.

invalid_output.title: Invalid outputs
invalid_output.description: Valid test cases for which the `.out` string is rejected by output validation.

valid_output.title: Valid outputs
valid_output.description: Valid test cases for which the `.out` must pass output validation.
